headline: Micron Stock Is ‘Expensive,’ Morgan Stanley Says. Why It’s Still a Buy.
summary: Micron Technology  has been among the biggest winners, rising 138% this year and 41% in September alone.  The firm upgraded Micron shares to Overweight from Equal-weight and boosted its price target to $220 from $160 in a research note Monday.  The stock is now ”very expensive,” said Morgan Stanley’s Joseph Moore, but demand has grown too strong to ignore.

content.title: Micron Stock Is ‘Expensive,’ Morgan Stanley Says. Why It’s Still a Buy.
content.summary: Micron Technology  has been among the biggest winners, rising 138% this year and 41% in September alone.  The firm upgraded Micron shares to Overweight from Equal-weight and boosted its price target to $220 from $160 in a research note Monday.  The stock is now ”very expensive,” said Morgan Stanley’s Joseph Moore, but demand has grown too strong to ignore.

headline: Why the Nasdaq Composite Is Beating the Dow Today

headline: Trump says the US has secured $17 trillion in new investments. The real number is likely much less
summary: The White House website lists total investments at $8.8 trillion, though that figure appears to be padded with some investment commitments made during Joe Biden's presidency.  The White House didn't lay out the math after multiple requests as to how Trump calculated $17 trillion in investment commitments.

content.title: Trump says the US has secured $17 trillion in new investments. The real number is likely much less
content.summary: The White House website lists total investments at $8.8 trillion, though that figure appears to be padded with some investment commitments made during Joe Biden's presidency.  The White House didn't lay out the math after multiple requests as to how Trump calculated $17 trillion in investment commitments.

headline: Why The Narrative Around Micron Is Changing After Recent Analyst Updates And Developments
summary: Micron Technology stock has seen a notable upward revision in its consensus analyst price target, which now stands at approximately $187 per share, up from $160. This change follows a strong quarterly performance and growing confidence in Micron's role as a key beneficiary of artificial intelligence related demand. Stay tuned to discover how you can follow the evolving narrative around Micron and what it may mean for investors going forward. What Wall Street Has Been Saying In the wake of...
